Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; pinkish cream slip; interior glazed streaky black with traces of added red; exterior: painted decoration consisting of ram (part of head, horn and neck remaining) to right; narrow cross as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 33, no. 25, pl. XVII)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 264, no. 565, pl. 71)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0607) (phase 2)
